column5: Nice report.  Sounds like a great weekend away - despite some lousy weather.  Beauty looking fish - makes me want to get out there!
Great report and pic's Joey... glad to see you's got out on the soft water...  I can't wait...
Way to brave the weather!
I didn't know that Paul fished in above zero temps! Must be slummin it!LOL Congrats on the fish, great pics and thanks for postin!~ HH
Thanks for your report and pictures, Joanne.  Nice to see youse two back out on the soft water.
Nice to see the boats coming out, 3 more weeks for me. Thanks for the report...
Great report joey!  Looks like you guys had a great time even though the weather was lousey. Thanx for shareing.
nice steelie!
Must feel pretty good being able to get out on the soft water again.   Very nice report.
Thanks for that Joey, and good to hear your weekend went so well !!
Great report and pics!!! and a very nice fish ta-boot!

Paul and I decided to get a way for the weekend so we headed down to the lower Niagara for a fish.  After checking into our hotel and unpacking, Paul realized he had forgotten the removable seat for the front casting deck and had to sit on a bucket to use the trolling motor all weekend.  He's got a bad case of ring around the you know what now, and I bet he won't make that mistake again    The temp was 6 and getting warmer and the wind was from the east.  Nobody was catching anything.  We saw the WFN boat while we waited for the bite to turn on.    I played with my zoom lense.    Then the weather changed and the wind started coming out of the West.  The bite was on.  We saw about 5 or 6 fish landed and Paul got into this nice 26 inch hen (and an entry for his team - Taper you have a PM).    Then as quick as the bite came on, it turned off again.  We fished until 5 p.m. then headed back to the launch.  While putting the boat on the trailer, a shore fisherman got into a nice steelie.  That was the second one caught on shore for the day.  We went out for a nice steak dinner at the Old Fire Hall and then back to the hotel for a good night's sleep ready for Sunday's fishing.  It was 10 degrees Sunday morning and it called for thunderstorms, but it was just overcast so we headed to the launch.  Aaron was launching when we got there and we had a quick chat and then headed out.    We weren't out long and it started to rain.  We were fine with that, but then the thunder started so we headed in.  I fished from shore for a bit until it really started coming down.    We thought we'd wait it out in the hotel room and Paul was anxiously sitting outside waiting for the rain to stop.    But it didn't stop and at some points was a torrential downpour.  Check out was 11 a.m. so we packed it up and headed home.  It was sure nice to get out in the boat and it was a nice relaxing time.  Really good weekend away from the city.  We'll probably be back there next weekend.  Hope the weather cooperates.  Here's a shot of the escarpment and one of an ice flow, one of many we had to watch out for while out there.      Cheers,  Joey
Nice report Joey. Looks like the same place you stayed on your last visit. I bet it felt good to get out on the open water.  Thanks for the report.

Nice report Joey thanks for sharing and nice bow and you did not get skunked .Too much ice here in Montreal to put a boat in the water. Yes I am jealous I mean envious.  Where ever you go there is a fishing camera crew??????????/
NICE JOB JOEY!!! ODD THE BITE WASNT HOT!!!! IT AND MISS KINDA DEAL I GUESS!!! ALWAYS ANOTHER WEEKENED  LOL
Cool report Joey. Well you guys got one nice one, and got out in the boat, I'm jealous, May 1st has been in my dreams, can't wait.
Great report Joey, I got your PM and posted it but I also got one from ccmtcanada and he beat paul by.75 inches. I left them both up for now so Paul gets a little glory. :clapping:Way to go team 6.
Nice to see a report like that Joey. Good stuff  Glad to see the reports with boats involved again.
Thanks all.  It was so nice to be on the open water that's for sure.  Clampet, that's not a cell phone, its a long zippo pipe lighter  Joey
Great report and pics joey,it sounds like you and paul had a great time  ,other than the rain,but you guys did catch some nice lookin fish,and had fun while doing it...  take care....cheers
....Very nice.
Gives you a better target for kickin dear!  Thanks for the nice report. Good to see you two out for a weekend away from home...and fishin none the less as well.
WTG Joey and Paul. Can't wait to get out
Nice report, man I got to get down and finally try the boat in the lower Niagara. Such a great fishery there, I have only tried from shore.
Great report Joey and nice rainbow Paul.  Regards, Sam
Nice report Joey - looks like you guys had a great time. Did you stick to the lower river or did you go out to the lake at all?   Don

We just stuck to the river Don.  With the unpredictable weather we don't like to go out into the lake in our boat.  Its only 16.5 ft and if the winds pick up its not fun.  Some guys that had gone out to the lake on Saturday said it was too rough and came back.  Joey
I take it then Joey that you put in at queenston ramp?  I live about 10 minutes from that ramp and have never used it. May give it a try on the weekend if I can get the boat ready on friday.   Don
nice to see people getting on the water  nothing like a happy man on his bucket
Nice report!!!  Sounds like even though the bite wasn't really on and the weather didn't cooperate, it was still a nice fishing trip.  Congrats on the steelie!  It was a nice one!

Yes Don, it was the Queenston ramp.  Its a pretty good ramp, its the parking that's the pits when there's alot of people there.  Quite a long walk if you have to park back up the hill.  Wayne, bullseye for sure!!!  LOL  Joey
Good report and nice pictures Joey. Looks like you are on a good start for the boat season. Better clean and get mine ready for next weekend ;-)  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Congrats to you and Tybo for getting out!  Whopper
Yea yea yea,just wait til Simcoe opens up.  Thanks for the report and pic,s J,
Does the heart good to see a soft water report...Thanks Joey, glad you guys managed to get away.  Maureen
Nice report Joey. I can't wait for my first open water trip of the year..
